condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Families, communities, civil society, private sector and governments has adopted comprehensive actions and integrated policies to promote Early Childhood Development

description.narrative: Considering the emerging priority of the Brazilian Government on strengthening its policies towards Early Childhood Development, UNICEF developed a strategic integrated framework on ECD and fostered high-level engagement at the national and subnational level. Public advocacy efforts to promote early children rights were held in nine large urban centers, reaching health professionals and families, as well as capacity building activities to strengthen the work of community health agents from municipalities of the UNICEF Seal. Lastly, UNICEF used a self-assessment methodology to evaluate the quality of the early childhood education of 7.558 pre-school units of municipalities in the Semiarid and Amazon. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of home visitors trained to work with vulnerable families In UNICEF Seal.

ECD Partnerships, including ECD Action Network (ECDAN), established at national level to coordinate the programme interventions and advocacy
